title: aspell: Rename 'darwin.patch' and apply it to all targets.
body:
I got the following error when installing `aspell` with Fujitsu compiler on `aarch64`.
```
  >> 1013    ./common/errors.hpp:26:38: error: redeclaration of 'aerror_bad_fil
             e_format' with a different type: 'const acommon::ErrorInfo *const'
              vs 'const struct AspellErrorInfo *const'
     1014    extern "C" const ErrorInfo * const   aerror_bad_file_format;
     1015                                         ^
     1016    ./interfaces/cc/aspell.h:249:47: note: previous declaration is her
             e
     1017    extern const struct AspellErrorInfo * const   aerror_bad_file_form
             at;
```
'aerror_bad_file_format' for C++ is already defined in `./common/errors.hpp`. `./interfaces/cc/aspell.h` is a header file shared by C and C++, so I think that it must be modified so that it does not redefine errors when referenced as C++.

Original `darwin.patch` is only applied to darwin platform, but this error can be got in other environments. So, I renamed 'darwin.patch' and apply it to all targets. If there is a problem, please let me know about countermeasures.
